There are many organizations and individuals who are leaders in the field of learning outcomes and who are known for their contributions to the development of measurement theories and models, as well as for their research on effective approaches for assessing and improving learning outcomes. Some examples of individuals who are recognized as leaders in this field include:

* Robert Gagné: Gagné is a well-known figure in the field of instructional design, and is known for his work on learning outcomes and the development of the Gagné Hierarchy of Learning. This model proposes a hierarchy of learning outcomes, with more complex outcomes building on simpler ones, and is widely used in the field.
* Benjamin Bloom: Bloom is another well-known figure in the field of instructional design, and is known for his work on learning outcomes and the development of the Bloom's Taxonomy of Learning Objectives. This model proposes a hierarchy of learning outcomes, with more complex outcomes building on simpler ones, and is widely used in the field.
* David Merrill: Merrill is known for his work on the concept of performance-based learning, which emphasizes the importance of aligning learning objectives with real-world performance goals. He is also known for his work on the concept of instructional design and the development of the First Principles of Instruction, which propose a set of general principles for designing effective learning experiences.

Overall, these and other leaders in the field of learning outcomes have made significant contributions to our understanding of how to assess and improve learning outcomes, and their work has had a significant impact on the field of instructional design and training evaluation.
